title: What is the main purpose of the Equality Act 2010? - Quora

response.answer_text: The purpose was mainly to protect peoples emotions, making it a crime to speak the truth. We see that YouTube, Facebook, Twitter, other social platforms and the system of law has followed up and is censoring so-called hate-speech, meaning speech that can hurt peoples emotions, whether true or not. The point is not if some claim is true or not, but whether someone that is intersectionalized, meaning allegedly discriminated against by default for being black, transgender, female, whatever, etc. The law was a law to silence opposition against the project of melting all cultures in the world into one big melting pot. Luckily many people are still speaking the truth, like David Wood of acts17apologetics  Unfortunately YouTube is discriminating against people speaking the truth DIRECTLY from the three basic islamic texts, but as I wrote: Truth has nothing to do with this.

The equalities Act 2010 pulled several existing laws together and clarified what is and isn’t considered hate crime, and providing workplace protection by specifically listing ‘protected characteristics’ that would be covered. It provides a framework for protection from discrimination, with the aim to promote a more equal and fair society. It pulls together Sex Discrimination Act 1975 Race Relations Act 1976 Disability Discrimination Act 1995 and adds some further details around other areas. The protected characteristics are: agedisabilitygender reassignmentracereligion or beliefsexsexual orientationmarriage and civil partnershippregnancy and maternity
